title: Part A (i,ii)
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned: For both a correct power formula and Ohm’s law, either shown explicitly or applied

1 point is earned: For a correct calculation of resistance

1 point is earned: For a correct calculation of current

This point was awarded if an incorrect value for resistance was correctly used with 120 V.

The calculations can be done in slightly different ways and in different orders. One example follows:

P = IV and I = V/R, so P = V2/R

R = V2/P = 480 Ω

I = V/R = 120 V/ 480 Ω = 0.25 A

(ii)

1 point is earned: For a correct calculation of resistance

1 point is earned: For a correct calculation of current

This point was awarded if an incorrect value for resistance was correctly used with 120 V.

Again, the calculations can be done in slightly different ways and in different orders. One example follows:

R = V2/P = 360Ω

I = V/R = 120 V/ 360 Ω = 0.33 A

title: Part B (i,ii)
stimulusHtml:
These two parts were scored as a unit

1 point is earned: For showing by calculation or by statement that the resistance in part (b)i is assumed to be the same as in part (a)i, and the resistance in part (b)ii is assumed to be the same as in part (a)ii

This point could also be awarded to students who recognized the bulbs as non-ohmic and stated this clearly, specifying lower resistances to be used in the solution.

R"30" = 480 Ω

R"40" = 360 Ω

1 point is earned: For adding both resistances to calculate the total series resistance Rtot used in the Ohm’s law calculation of current

Rtot = 480Ω + 360Ω + 840Ω

1 point is earned: For calculating the correct current in part (b)i, or for a current consistent with the total resistance calculated

I"30" = Itot = V/Rtot = 120 V/840 Ω = 0.14 A

1 point is earned: For stating that the current in part (b)ii is the same as in part (b)i, whether or not the (b)i current is correct

I"40" = I"30" = Itot = 0.14 A

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
__2__30 W bulb in the parallel circuit

__1__40 W bulb in the parallel circuit

__3__30 W bulb in the series circuit

__4 _40 W bulb in the series circuit

1 point is earned: For any order showing that both bulbs in parallel are brighter than both in series

1 point is earned: For any order showing the 40 W bulb in the parallel circuit is brighter than the 30 W bulb in the parallel circuit

1 point is earned: For any order showing the “30 W” bulb in the series circuit is brighter than the “40 W” bulb in the series circuit
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

__2__30 W bulb in the parallel circuit

__1__40 W bulb in the parallel circuit

__3__30 W bulb in the series circuit

__4 _40 W bulb in the series circuit

1 point is earned: For any order showing that both bulbs in parallel are brighter than both in series

1 point is earned: For any order showing the 40 W bulb in the parallel circuit is brighter than the 30 W bulb in the parallel circuit

1 point is earned: For any order showing the “30 W” bulb in the series circuit is brighter than the “40 W” bulb in the series circuit

title: Part D (i,ii)
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned: For a correct answer or calculation consistent with values reported in part (a)

Ptot = 30 W + 40 W = 70 W

OR Ptot = V2/Rtot = (120V)2/206Ω = 70 W

OR Ptot = ∑VI = (120 V)(0.25 A) + (120 V)(0.33 A) = 70 W

(ii)

1 point is earned: For using values from part (b) correctly in the equations

1 point is earned: For correct answer or calculation consistent with values reported in part (b)

Ptot = V2/Rtot = ∑I2R = VI = 17 W
